thread.title: Evening of inclusion and solidarity for members of Pittsburgh's Jewish and Muslim communities
thread.title_full: Evening of inclusion and solidarity for members of Pittsburgh's Jewish and Muslim communities

author: Photographs by Haley Nelson / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: Evening of inclusion and solidarity for members of Pittsburgh's Jewish and Muslim communities
text:
Evening of inclusion and solidarity for members of Pittsburgh's Jewish and Muslim communities February 17, 2017 10:28 PM Haley Nelson/Post-Gazette Mona Ramadan, from Regent Square, stands as the other people at her table light the Shabbat candles and make their pre-meal prayers at the Jewish-Muslim Shabbat dinner Friday, at Temple Sinai in Squirrel Hill. Photographs by Haley Nelson / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 
Muslims and Jews dined and prayed together at Temple Sinai in Squirrel Hill for the Friday evening Shabbat service in a show of solidarity against fear. 
Mona Ramadan, of the Regent Square neighborhood in Pittsburgh, stood as the other people at her table lit the Shabbat candles and made their pre-meal prayers at the Jewish-Muslim Shabbat dinner for inclusion and solidarity. Ramadan had been to other inter-faith events but had never been to a synagogue before. "I think in this time we need to focus on things that bring us together," she said. Abdul Wajid, Religious Director at the Islamic Center of Pittsburgh, far left, leads, left to right, Humar Omar, Omar Mussa, and Nour El-Deen in their evening prayer at the Jewish-Muslim Shabbat dinner for inclusion and solidarity on Friday at Temple Sinai in the Squirrel Hill. Members of the Jewish and Muslim community fill their plates at the Jewish-Muslim Shabbat dinner for inclusion and solidarity on Friday at Temple Sinai in Squirrel Hill. Cathy C. Droz, right, explains the pre- and post-meal prayers to Qwanetta Andrews at the Jewish-Muslim Shabbat dinner for inclusion and solidarity on Friday at Temple Sinai in Squirrel Hill. Nour El-Deen, left, Omar Mussa, center, and Humar Omar do their evening prayer at the Jewish-Muslim Shabbat dinner for inclusion and solidarity on Friday at Temple Sinai in Squirrel Hill. Human Omar, left, participates in the Jewish service at the Jewish-Muslim Shabbat dinner for inclusion and solidarity on Friday evening.
